He has been a leader in finding ways to make our schools safer, and I am proud to continue working with him to obtain these funds.

Metal detectors + other deterrents can help prevent another devastating incident like Parkland from happening again. The legislation also ensures school districts and local law enforcement officers have the proper resources to mitigate + respond to emergency and crises situations

This legislation includes $100 million for the STOP School Violence Act, of which I was a co-sponsor of and was signed into law last year by President Trump. This grant program is a critical investment for localities who seek to improve their school hardening capabilities.
On the anniversary of the Parkland tragedy, I am honored to say we approved additional funding for school safety in tonight‚Äôs government funding bill.

I congratulate @RepKayGranger @NitaLowey. It‚Äôs because of their willingness to negotiate in good faith that we were able to reach this bipartisan agreement. I look forward to working with them + our colleagues to begin the FY20 process to fund critical programs families rely on.

Community Development Block Grants (CDBG) + the Home Investment Partnership Program, which allow municipalities to expand access to affordable housing, continue to see strong $ levels. I recognize the importance of ensuring our neediest receive the housing and care they need.
In respect to housingüè†, the bill prioritizes funding for our most vulnerable populations, helping the elderly, disabled individuals, veterans, and those living with HIV/AIDS.

Just one example:Over $800M is provided for Transit Infrastructure Grants, including $350M for Bus+Bus Facilities Grants that support our local public bus systems. @MiamiDadeCounty received 2 grants from this program last yr + will hopefully see further dollars in the coming year
In fact, Southern Florida has already reaped the benefits of these programs in the previous year, and I am confident we will continue to see investments made in our communities this year. #SoFla

The legislation continues the strong levels of funding for BUILD grants, Capital Investment Grants, + Airports and Highway Grants, allowing localities like those in @CollierPIO, Hendry County, + @MiamiDadeCounty to compete for federal money to upgrade and expand their facilities
I‚Äôm proud of my work to support Florida‚Äôs seaports and I look forward to building on this program in the future. Sailing away from ports and into other #transport items in this bill...

This seaport funding will have a direct benefit to the Sunshine State. $93 million is set aside for the top 15 container ports, which includes both @PortMiami @PortEverglades, with priority given to projects with a critical issue both ports face - fumigation fees.

Over the past year I heard from so many port authorities in Florida and across the nation on the need for a dedicated port funding pool. That‚Äôs why nearly $300 million is delivered in this legislation to improve our nation‚Äôs seaports.

It furthers historic levels of funding to repair our nation‚Äôs aging infrastructure. It‚Äôs continued progress towards revitalizing our roadways, bridges, airports, transit systems, ‚ùóÔ∏èand for the first time‚ùóÔ∏è, our seaports! üö¢

I reiterate my commitment to working with any Member of Congress, Republican or Democrat, Representative or Senator, who wants to resolve this issue once and for all.
Just tonight, I presented four amendments that would address the legal status of DREAMers and TPS beneficiaries, yet Speaker Pelosi was not willing to consider even one of them.

We must find a solution to the more than 11 million undocumented individuals who are living in the shadows, + that solution must be reasonable and humane. Lastly, a bipartisan solution to immigration reform must bolster the economy + respect the rule of law of this great nation.

We must modernize our visa system so that American business owners have the power to lawfully hire employees for job vacancies that are hard to fill. Modernizing our visa system also allows us to better track who is traveling through our borders.
The US has the responsibility to determine who and what goes through its borders. There are numerous issues that are problematic and remain unsolved.
Speaker Pelosi: let‚Äôs put aside the political games, reopen the government, secure our border, and give permanent, legal status to DREAMers and TPS beneficiaries.

Every day that passes, this shutdown becomes more damaging, hurting hundreds of thousands of federal workers, as well as Americans across the country that rely on government programs affected by the lapse in funding.
Sadly, this is not the first time the rhetoric of Democratic leadership does not align with their actions.

Just last year, Speaker Pelosi spent eight hours on the House floor, demanding a vote on a DREAMer bill. Yet, here I am, giving her not one, not two, not three, but FOUR opportunities to help DREAMers, and she is handily rejecting them all.

Democratic leadership is so focused on political gimmickry, they refused to even allow consideration of amendments that would reopen the government and resolve an issue they claim is one of their top priorities.

Earlier this evening, I presented four amendments to four different bills in the House Rules Committee that would provide funding to secure our border and offer a permanent solution for #DREAMers and those with expiring Temporary Protected Status (#TPS).

I am pleased with the work we have done to upgrade our nation‚Äôs infrastructure, and am humbled that my Subcommittee Chairmanship affords me the unique opportunity to help our nation and our local community. #SFL

Housing for the elderly is funded at $632M, vouchers for disabled citizens is funded at $390M, and housing assistance for those living with HIV/AIDS is funded at $393M. I am confident we are helping those with the most need in this legislation.
Also included is $1.2 billion for the HOME Investment Partnerships Program, which leverages this funding with private investments to create more affordable housing options.

Expanding access to affordable #housing is also emphasized in this legislation. CDBG grants are funded at $3.3 billion dollars, providing localities with the opportunity to apply for grants that address community development, poverty, and other infrastructure needs.
With this bill, our local community is empowered to revitalize the roads, bridges, buses, and rail lines we use every day.

Our local #airports can pull from $500M provided to Airport Grants, our community will receive needed funds from $4.25B provided for Highway Grants, + our bus&rail systems can benefit from $2.6B provided for Cap Investment Grants or $800 million for transit infrastructure grants

In turn, this will create jobs across the country and locally, and will lead to a boost in our economy. Right here in #SFL, localities can compete for the $750 million provided to the multimodal BUILD program for new infrastructure projects.

For the second year in a row, I have worked to protect hard-earned taxpayer dollars and reduce waste and abuse, while providing historic funding levels to improve our airports, roads, bridges, and seaports.
